io.github.trulyfree.modular.module

Interface ModifiableParentModule<T extends Module>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The module type supported by this ParentModule. It is likely that most implementations will generalize this to Module, but implementations may vary.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Module, ParentModule<T>

    public interface ModifiableParentModule<T extends Module>
extends ParentModule<T>
    ModifiableParentModule interface. All modules with multiple child modules which may be swapped in or out during execution should implement this interface. If the child modules should not be modifiable during runtime, consider using the ParentModule interface instead. It is highly recommended that all implementations of this class use only non-final instance fields as to assure the usefulness of the setup and destroy methods of the Module interface from which this interface extends.
    Author:
    vtcakavsmoace

      • Methods inherited from interface io.github.trulyfree.modular.module.Module

    • Method Detail

      • addModule

        boolean addModule(T module)
        Method to be called in order to add a child module to this parent module.
        Parameters:
        module - The module to add as a child of this parent module.
        Returns:
        success A boolean representing the success of the adding of the module as a child of this parent module. If the adding process should fail in any way, return false; otherwise, return true.

      • removeModule

        T removeModule(T module)
        Method to be called in order to remove a specific child module from this parent module.
        Parameters:
        module - The module or a module equal to the module being removed.
        Returns:
        removed The module which was removed by this operation. If no module was removed, this should return null.

      • removeModuleByType

        default Collection<T> removeModuleByType(Class<? extends Module> type)
        Method to be called in order to remove all of a type of module from the children of this parent module. A suggested implementation has been provided, but implementations may differ on the approach chosen.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of module to remove. Note that this should respect polymorphism.
        Returns:
        removed The module(s) removed by this operation. If no module is removed, this should return an empty collection of modules.

      • clear

        default void clear()
        Method to be called in order to remove all children of this parent module. A suggested implementation has been provided which acts as a simple call of removeAllByType when passed Method.class. Implementations may differ according to need. The return type chosen is intended as a quick-and-dirty way to convert this modifiable parent module into a unmodifiable parent module by constructing an implementation of ParentModule to with the collection returned.
